headline: Walmart and Costco Are 1/3 of XLP’s Defensive Portfolio, Creating A Huge Risk For A Defensive Holding
summary: The consumer staples sector exists because people need to eat, clean, and maintain routines regardless of what the economy does. Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR Fund (NYSEARCA:XLP) packages that defensive logic into a single ticker, concentrating 99.3% of its portfolio in companies that produce essentials like groceries, household goods, and beverages. With $16.2 billion in ... Walmart and Costco Are 1/3 of XLP’s Defensive Portfolio, Creating A Huge Risk For A Defensive Holding

headline: 2 Reasons to Watch COST and 1 to Stay Cautious

headline: Costco faces lawsuit over alleged salmonella at chicken plant
summary: The lawsuit points to a study by an anti-factory farming organization that claims Costco's Nebraska processing plant sends "unsafe chickens" to stores.

headline: Is Costco Wholesale (COST) Pricing Leave Enough Upside After Recent Share Price Gains
summary: If you are wondering whether Costco Wholesale’s current share price matches its underlying worth, you are not alone. This article is built to help you separate price from value. Over the short term, Costco Wholesale’s stock has moved, with a 4.2% return over the last 7 days, 5.0% over 30 days, 18.4% year to date, a 3.7% decline over the past year, a 110.0% return over 3 years, and 212.3% over 5 years. Recent headlines have continued to focus on Costco Wholesale’s position as a large scale...
